text: WAL PROTOCOL The DBMS stages all a txn's log records in volatile storage (usually backed by buffer pool). All log records pertaining to an updated page are written to non-volatile storage before the page itself is over-written in non-volatile storage. A txn is not considered committed until all its log records have been written to stable storage. e \ '.—:\ e M » PI % 4351/1:1518 - WAL PROTOCOL > © $ - O- 20 - Database Logging Schemes (CMU Databases Systems / Fall 2019)
